question: Which country's national police force is "National Gendarmerie"?
explanation: National Gendarmerie is one of the two national police forces of France, along with the National Police. It is a branch of the French Armed Forces placed under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of the Interior-with additional duties to the Ministry of Defence. Its area of responsibility includes smaller towns, rural and suburban areas, while the National Police, a civilian force, is in charge of cities and their centers.
